alert.note: Alert for Alfalfa; Grant; Kay (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 4:23AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Kay, Alfalfa and Grant Counties through 500 AM CDT... At 422 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles northwest of South Haven to near Caldwell to 11 miles north of Wakita to 7 miles west of Manchester to near Kiowa. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blackwell, Tonkawa, Cherokee, Medford, Pond Creek, Lamont, Carmen, Wakita, Braman, Jet, Nash, Burlington, Deer Creek, Manchester, Amorita, Byron, Jefferson, Renfrow, Lambert and Nardin. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 214 and 234. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
